title: Fix Access Denied “Back to Login” navigation and confirm admin username

requirements.text: Fix the “Back to Login” button on the Admin “Access Denied” screen so it always navigates to the admin login form route `/admin/login`.

quotes: the 'back to login' button on the access denied page is not working. please fix the link so it takes me to the login form.

acceptanceCriteria: When an unauthorized user hits the AdminLayoutPage “Access Denied” state, clicking “Back to Login” navigates to `/admin/login` and renders the AdminLoginPage form.
Navigation works reliably (no no-op click) across refreshes and direct deep-links into `/admin/*` routes.

requirements.text: Ensure the default admin username is clearly communicated in-app and in documentation: confirm the admin login route is `/admin/login` and the default admin username is `admin` (English user-facing text).

quotes: Also, tell me the admin username so I can log in once it's fixed.

acceptanceCriteria: The Admin login UI displays the default username as `admin` (and does not contradict it elsewhere in the UI).
The frontend documentation (frontend/README.md) explicitly states: admin login URL `/admin/login` and default admin username `admin` (in English).

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (Shadcn UI components are read-only).
Do not modify any paths listed in frontend.immutablePaths (e.g., frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
nonGoals: Changing the admin authentication mechanism, token issuance, or backend authorization logic.
Adding new admin roles/permissions or implementing new admin features beyond fixing the broken navigation and clarifying default credentials.
